reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the collection of data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that data is collected from various sources, including user input, other sources, and automatically. This declaration indicates that the app acknowledges its data collection practices.
reply.reference: Shoorah Ltd will collect your Data in a number of ways, for example: when you contact us through the Website, by telephone, post, e-mail or through any other means; when you register with us and set up an account to receive our products/services; when you complete surveys that we use for research purposes...in each case, in accordance with this privacy policy. URL: https://shoorah.io/privacy-policy/

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects the following types of data: name, date of birth, gender, job title, profession, contact information, demographic information, financial information, IP address, web browser type and version, operating system, URLs, In-App tracking data, including user behavior and inputs in features such as journal and moods.

reply.analysis: The answer is extracted from the 'Data collected' section of the privacy policy, listing the specific types of data collected by the app.
reply.reference: The app collects the following Data, which includes personal Data, from you: name; date of birth; gender; job title; profession; contact Information such as email addresses and telephone numbers; demographic information such as postcode, preferences and interests; financial information such as credit / debit card numbers; IP address (automatically collected); web browser type and version (automatically collected); operating system (automatically collected); a list of URLs ... In App tracking data such as, user behaviour and counts of inputs in features such as journal and moods. URL: https://shoorah.io/privacy-policy/

reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the purpose of data collection and use.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that data is collected for tracking purposes and enhancing personalized experiences within the app while respecting user privacy, indicating a declared purpose of data collection and use.
reply.reference: Your data is collected for tracking purposes, enhancing personalized experiences within the app while respecting your privacy. URL: https://shoorah.io/privacy-policy/

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of data collection or delete data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy mentions the right to restrict the use of data, request the deletion or removal of data, and withdraw consent for data processing.
reply.reference: Right to erase – the right to request that we delete or remove your Data from our systems. Right to restrict our use of your Data – the right to 'block' us from using your Data or limit the way in which we can use it. To make enquiries, exercise any of your rights set out above, or withdraw your consent to the processing of your Data (where consent is our legal basis for processing your Data), please contact us via this e-mail address: info@shoorah.io. URL: https://shoorah.io/privacy-policy/

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app shares data with third parties as outlined in the privacy policy.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the app shares data with various third parties for different purposes, as described in the document.
reply.reference: We may share your Data with the following groups of people for the following reasons: any of our group companies or affiliates, our employees, agents and/or professional advisors, third party service providers, third party payment providers, and relevant authorities. URL: https://shoorah.io/privacy-policy/

reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: The app shares data with group companies or affiliates, employees, agents, professional advisors, third party service providers, third party payment providers (e.g., Apple & Google pay), and relevant authorities.

content: third party payment providers (e.g., Apple & Google pay)

reply.analysis: The privacy policy explicitly states the specific groups of people with whom the app shares data and the reasons for sharing such as administration, obtaining advice, processing of payments, facilitating detection of crime or tax collection.
reply.reference: The app may share Data with group companies or affiliates, employees, agents, professional advisors, third party service providers, third party payment providers, and relevant authorities for specific purposes mentioned in the privacy policy. URL: https://shoorah.io/privacy-policy/
